alert.note: Alert for Northern Franklin; Southeastern St. Lawrence; Southern Franklin; Western Clinton; Western Essex (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Burlington (Northern Vermont and New York)
info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued December 10 at 2:19PM EST until December 11 at 7:00PM EST by NWS Burlington
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 10 PM THIS EVENING TO 7 PM EST MONDAY... * WHAT...Heavy wet snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 6 to 12 inches. Winds gusting as high as 30 mph. * WHERE...Portions of northern New York. * WHEN...From 10 PM this evening to 7 PM EST Monday. * IMPACTS...Travel will be very difficult, especially during the Monday morning commute. Isolated to scattered power outages are possible. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Rain will change to snow across the Adirondack Mountains this evening, with snow levels lowering to valley floors by midnight. Snowfall rates on Monday morning will likely exceed 1 inch per hour. Furthermore, gusty northwest winds 25 to 35 mph could produce additional power outages on Monday afternoon into Monday night.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. Please allow extra time if travel is necessary.

area.areaDesc: Northern Franklin; Southeastern St. Lawrence; Southern Franklin; Western Clinton; Western Essex
